greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse to A290308.
comment: The sequence n -> a(n-1) (with n > 0) is an analog of A005940 for the decimal base.
a(A052382(k) * 10^(n-1)) = prime(n)^k  for any n > 0 and k > 0 (where prime(n) is the n-th prime).
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500
Rémy Sigrist, PARI program for A290389
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
mathematica: f[n_] := Function[m, Sum[(1 + Mod[Floor[(8 n + 1 - 9^m)/(8*9^j)], 9]) 10^j, {j, 0, m - 1}]]@ Floor@ Log[9, 8 n + 1]; Block[{nn = 35, s},s = Association@ Array[f@ # -> # &, nn]; {1}~Join~Table[Times @@ MapIndexed[Prime[First[#2]]^#1 &, If[DigitCount[n, 10, 0] > 0, Function[t, Reverse@ Flatten@ Apply[Join, {SplitBy[Take[Reverse@ t, Length@ t - Length@ #],0] /. z_List /; First@ z == 0 :> Most@ z, #}] &@ TakeWhile[t, # == 0 &]]@ Reverse@ IntegerDigits[n], {Lookup[s, n]}]], {n, nn}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 31 2017 *)
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Jul 29 2017
